Class NodeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • NodeHandler
  • public class NodeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages communication and file transfer with connected data nodes. If any of these methods result in an error, the connection to this node is restarted. Implements a fair ReentrantLock for thread safety.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.util.Comparator<NodeHandler> LEAST_ACCESSED_ORDER
      Comparator for sorting nodes based on least number of total actions.
      static NodeHandler NULL_HANDLER
      NodeHandler instances with all null fields, available as a NIL value in data structures that do not support null values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeHandler

        public NodeHandler​(java.net.Socket node,
                   java.lang.String nodeID,
                   java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​NodeHandler> activeNodes,
                   java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​NodeHandler> inactiveNodes)
        Class constructor. Gets information required to communicate with this data node.
        Parameters:
        node - Socket instance for this node connection
        nodeID - the ID or name associated with the connected node
        activeNodes - the set of active nodes
        inactiveNodes - the set of inactive nodes

      • NodeHandler

        public NodeHandler​(java.net.Socket node,
                   java.lang.String nodeID,
                   java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​NodeHandler> activeNodes,
                   java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​NodeHandler> inactiveNodes,
                   int totalActions)
        Class constructor. Also initializes the totalActions count for this instance. Useful for reconnecting a previously connected node.
        Parameters:
        node - Socket instance for this node connection
        nodeID - the ID or name associated with the connected node
        activeNodes - the set of active nodes
        inactiveNodes - the set of inactive nodes
        totalActions - initial value for the totalActions count

    • Method Detail

      • getTotalActions

        public int getTotalActions()
        Returns the total sum of inserts, deletes, and accesses for this node during this server session.
        Returns:
        the action count for this node

      • getNodeID

        public java.lang.String getNodeID()
        Returns the node ID or name associated with this connected node
        Returns:
        the name of this node

      • fileList

        public java.lang.String fileList​(java.lang.String username)
        Requests a list of this node's user files and returns it in a String.
        Parameters:
        username - the username for the files to retrieve
        Returns:
        a String of files, possibly empty, or null on error

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists​(java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String filename,
                          long size)
        Sends a request to the server to check if a file exists. If this method returns false, meaning the data node did not have the specified file, the node assumes it should, restarts and fixes any problems in the NodeHandler when it reconnects.
        Parameters:
        username - username associated with the file to check
        filename - name of the file to check
        size - size of the file to check
        Returns:
        true if the server contains the file, false otherwise

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String filename)
        Sends a request to the node to delete a file.
        Parameters:
        username - the username associated with the file to delete
        filename - the name of the file to delete

      • transferFileToNode

        public void transferFileToNode​(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               long fileSize,
                               NodeHandler recipient)
        Transfer a file from this connected node to another. Uses the startFileTransferToNode method of the other NodeHandler.
        Parameters:
        username - the username associated with the file to transfer
        filename - the name of the file to transfer
        fileSize - the size in bytes of the file to transfer. This must be accurate.
        recipient - the NodeHandler instance for the node receiving the file

      • transferFileToClient

        public void transferFileToClient​(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String filename,
                                 long fileSize,
                                 java.io.BufferedOutputStream clientBos)
        Transfer a file from this connected node to a client.
        Parameters:
        username - the username associated with the file to transfer
        filename - the name of the file to transfer
        fileSize - the size in bytes of the file to transfer. This must be accurate.
        clientBos - the BufferedOutputStream instance for the client receiving the file

      • isResponding

        public boolean isResponding()
        Sends a test instruction to this connected node to determin if it is responding. If the node is not responding, it is removed from the activeNodes set and the connection is reset.
        Returns:
        true if the node responds normally, false otherwise

      • startFileTransferToNode

        public void startFileTransferToNode​(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String filename,
                                    long size)
        Sends a request to transfer a file to this connected node. This method grants the calling thread a lock. It must be followed by sendFileBytes() and endFileTransferToNode(). This method will retrieve this NodeHandler's lock and it will not be returned until endFileTransferToNode() has been called.
        Parameters:
        username - the username associated with the file to transfer
        filename - the name of the file to transfer
        size - the size in bytes of the file to transfer. This must be accurate.

      • sendFileBytes

        public void sendFileBytes​(byte[] bytes,
                          int numBytes)
        Sends the specified number of bytes from the buffer to this connected node. To be called after startFileTransferToNode() and before endFileTransferToNode().
        Parameters:
        bytes - buffer containing bytes to transfer
        numBytes - the number of bytes to read from the buffer. This must be accurate.

      • endFileTransferToNode

        public void endFileTransferToNode()
        Ends the file tranfer to this node. To be called after all bytes are transferred using the sendFileBytes() method. This will return the lock and allow other threads to use methods in this object.
